History: Patient has been trying to find a job but has been unsuccessful so far. She had a drink 3 weeks ago which made her feel like a failure. She again indulged in drinking behavior last week and had more than 4-5 drinks which made her feel defeated and guilty; Substance history: Patient consumes alcohol.
Current Mental Status Examination: General behavior: Patient was cooperative and rapport has been established; Mood: Anxious; Affect: Restricted; Thought: Content- Ideas of shame and guilt about oneself; Judgement: Personal judgement impaired; Insight: Grade 5
Psychotherapy Type: Type: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy; Mode: Individual
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient expressed her shame that she had been experiencing for not having a job and drinking instead which then makes her feel guilty.
Reflections by the therapist: Patient has been making hasty decisions which makes her land in a space of shame about herself. She is not holding a job currently, which adds further to the feelings of guilt. She then makes harsh judgement about own self which directly affects her self identity and also about the people who associated with such behaviors. The session revolved around making her more aware of her behaviours and to separate her identity from those behaviors.
Action Plan: Patient has been told to document her judgement about her behavior to gain more insight. This is to further use it as an evidence before making risky decisions.
